_header: There is a saying both old and true
_description: A moral poem on honest mirth — six six-line stanzas and a four-line pseudo-burden: ‘Nowe will ye be mery & can ye be merye / I pray you be mery mery mery mery / Be as mery as yowe cane / So shall yow please bothe god & man’.

VandADyce45.First Lines:
Ther ys a saying bothe olde & treweAll honeste myrthe ys goode
                    vertu…
VandADyce45.Last Lines:
…Whoo bryngythe all perfette myrthe to manHow can yowe be but
                    mery than
